Dear e e: 

On 10/4/2023 9:24:52 PM, the Village of Oak Brook received your written request for inspection, copying, or certification of the Village public records described above. Enclosed please find requested documents. Please see section 5 below for redactions and do not hesitate to reach out with questions or concerns. 
1.             Decision on Request 

___       Your request is approved in its entirety. 
X        Your request is approved in part and denied in part.  Those records for which your request is denied are identified in Section 5 below. 

___       Your request is hereby denied in its entirety.  Those records for which your request is denied are identified in Section 5 below. 
2.             Availability of Records 

The response to your request is not subject to payment of any required fees or postage, and pursuant to the sections below, all of the public records for which your request is approved will be made available as follows.  (See Section 5 for the public records for which your request is denied.) 

Copies of the following public records will be: 

___       Made available for your inspection at the Village Hall as indicated in Section 3 below. 

___       Made available for pick up by you at the Village Hall as indicated in Section 3 below. 

___       Mailed to you at the address you provided in your request. 
_ x__       Sent to you via email at the email address you provided in your request. 
3.             Appointment for Inspection or Pick‑up 

___       The Records are available for inspection or pick‑up at Village Hall.  You must call the FOIA Officer at _________________ to schedule an appointment for inspection or pick up of the records. 

If you have not made an appointment to inspect or pick up the specified records within five Business Days after the date of this Notice, then the records will be re-filed. 

___       Pursuant to Sections 2(c-10) and 3.1 of the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, the Village has determined that your request is made for commercial purposes, or the Village has determined that you are a recurrent requester pursuant to Sections 2(g) and 3.2 of the Act.  The records therefore will be available for inspection or pick-up on or after ________________, 20___ (the “Availability Date”).  If you do not make an appointment to inspect or pick up the records on or before the fifth Business Day after the Availability Date, then the records will be re-filed. 
4.             Mailing of Records 

___       Your request to have the records mailed to you has been denied because you have not shown that it would be unduly burdensome for you to arrange to pick up the records. 

___       Your request to have the Village mail the specified records to you has been approved.  However, before the Village will mail the specified records, you must pay the balance, if any, and the following additional amount to cover the cost of postage:  $________________. 
5.             Denial of Request 

Your request is denied as to the following records or redacted information contained in those records: private or personal information 

A. Responsible Official.  The Village’s FOIA Officer is the official responsible for this denial. 

B. Notice of Right to Review by Illinois Attorney General.  You have the right to file a request for review of your request and this Notice of Denial by the Public Access Counselor of the Office of the Illinois Attorney General.  The Public Access Counselor may be contacted at 500 South 2nd Street, Springfield, Illinois 62701, by telephone at (877)299-3642 or by email at public.access@ilag.gov. 

C. Notice of Right to Judicial Review.  Under Section 11 of the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/11, you have the right to seek judicial review of this denial.  The Village cannot advise or represent you in this matter.  You should consult your own legal counsel. 

D. Justification for Denial.  Your request is being denied with respect to the specified records because the specified records are exempt from disclosure pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act for the following reason or reasons (references are to sections of the Act): 
X        The records are private information. § 2(c-5), §7(1)(b) 
Applies to: personal phone numbers and signatures AND the following: (f) Preliminary drafts, notes, recommendations, memoranda and other records in which opinions are expressed, or policies or actions are formulated, except that a specific record or relevant portion of a record shall not be exempt when the record is publicly cited and identified by the head of the public body. The exemption provided in this paragraph (f) extends to all those records of officers and agencies of the General Assembly that pertain to the preparation of legislative documents. 
(g) Trade secrets and commercial or financial information obtained from a person or business where the trade secrets or commercial or financial information are furnished under a claim that they are proprietary, privileged, or confidential, and that disclosure of the trade secrets or commercial or financial information would cause competitive harm to the person or business, and only insofar as the claim directly applies to the records requested. 
(h) Proposals and bids for any contract, grant, or agreement, including information which if it were disclosed would frustrate procurement or give an advantage to any person proposing to enter into a contractor agreement with the body, until an award or final selection is made. Information prepared by or for the body in preparation of a bid solicitation shall be exempt until an award or final selection is made. 
(i) Valuable formulae, computer geographic systems, designs, drawings and research data obtained or produced by any public body when disclosure could reasonably be expected to produce private gain or public loss. The exemption for "computer geographic systems" provided in this paragraph (i) does not extend to requests made by news media as defined in Section 2 of this Act when the requested information is not otherwise exempt and the only purpose of the request is to access and disseminate information regarding the health, safety, welfare, or legal rights of the general public. 
(u) Information that would disclose or might lead to the disclosure of secret or confidential information, codes, algorithms, programs, or private keys intended to be used to create electronic signatures under the Uniform Electronic Transactions Act. 
(v) Vulnerability assessments, security measures, and response policies or plans that are designed to identify, prevent, or respond to potential attacks upon a community's population or systems, facilities, or installations, the destruction or contamination of which would constitute a clear and present danger to the health or safety of the community, but only to the extent that disclosure could reasonably be expected to jeopardize the effectiveness of the measures or the safety of the personnel who implement them or the public. Information exempt under this item may include such things as details pertaining to the mobilization or deployment of personnel or equipment, to the operation of communication systems or protocols, or to tactical operations. 

___     Disclosure of the records would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. §1, §7(1)(c) 

Sincerely, 

Sylwia Slodyczka 
Deputy FOIA Officer 
Village of Oak Brook 
1200 Oak Brook Rd. Oak Brook, IL 60523 

Phone:   630.368.5032 
Fax:   630.368.5033

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Lake Jackson Texas Police - Arrest of Rolando Reyes by Officer Johnny Cagle and Officer Mendoza - Officer Johnny Cagle's Complaints & IA Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) A copy of any and all complaint(s) received for the following officer: Officer Johnny Cagle.

2) A copy of any and all Internal Affairs Report(s) and or Finding(s) for the following officer: Officer Johnny Cagle.

3) A copy of any and all Disciplinary Record(s) for the following officer: Officer Johnny Cagle.

4) A copy of any termination paperwork, or letter of resignation from the following officer:  Officer Johnny Cagle.

Excluded from this request:

a) Confidential information deemed protected by Texas Law, Statute or Attorney General Ruling.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request #PD-2023-400
communications.communication:
Lake Jackson,

Section 552.001 states:  (. . .) it is the policy of this state that each person is entitled, unless otherwise expressly provided by law, at all times to complete information about the affairs of government and the official acts of public officials and employees.

Unless there is a specific exception listed in Chapter 552, all documents must be released unless the government agency requests a decision from the Attorney General’s Office. This request must be made within 10 business days from the receipt of the request. (Sec. 552.301). Your office acknowledged receipt of my request on October 10, 2023 and have failed to request a decision from the Texas Attorney General's Office to withhold any documents.

The request for the following documents have been denied by your office:
•	A copy of the complaint against Officer Johnny Cagle. A complaint was not found in the Employee File released.
•	A copy of the IA Report for the complaint against Officer Johnny Cagle.

The department has provided a copy of some type of disciplinary action taken against Officer Johnny Cagle, meaning you must have first complied with Section 614.023 of the Texas Government Code:
•	Sec. 614.023.  COPY OF COMPLAINT TO BE GIVEN TO OFFICER OR EMPLOYEE.  
•	A copy of a signed complaint against a law enforcement officer of this state or a fire fighter, detention officer, county jailer, or peace officer appointed or employed by a political subdivision of this state shall be given to the officer or employee within a reasonable time after the complaint is filed.
•	Disciplinary action may not be taken against the officer or employee unless a copy of the signed complaint is given to the officer or employee.
•	In addition to the requirement of Subsection (b), the officer or employee may not be indefinitely suspended or terminated from employment based on the subject matter of the complaint unless:
o	the complaint is investigated; and
o	there is evidence to prove the allegation of misconduct.

There are two recent Attorney General Decisions that address Internal Affairs Reports you had available to review. Cornyn OR99-1167 and Abbott OR 2012-02011.
With the evidence of disciplinary action taken against Officer Johnny Cagle, I am requesting copies of the documents previously withheld by your department. If the department continues to withhold the requested documents, we will file a Formal Criminal Complaint with the Brazoria County District Attorney’s Office and then to the Texas Attorney’s Office for your violation of the Texas Public Information Act.

Please provide the documents as required by Texas Law.

Attached:

	OAG Decision: Abbott OR2012-02011
	OAG Decision: Cornyn OR99-1167
	Draft copy of Formal Complaint to District Attorney’s Office

title: Hedge Fund Request

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Hedge Fund Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

You kindly sent us copies of your records that show information as listed below dated to March 31 2023. Please will it be possible to have an update on any records that would show some or all of the following information:

1. A list of ALL hedge funds and fund of hedge funds in which Richmond Retirement System is an investor; and

2. For each hedge fund and fund of hedge funds, may I please have a copy of any records that would show some or all of the following information:

a. the month by month market value of Richmond Retirement System's holding in each fund from January 1 2023 to June 30 2023,

b. the month by month amount invested by Richmond Retirement System in each fund from January 1 2023 to June 30 2023,

c. the month by month net returns (net of fees) earned by Richmond Retirement System on its investment in each fund from January 1 2023 to June 30 2023

Additionally we are missing the December 2022 data so we would be grateful if you could include this information aswell.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

Sincerely,

Nanette Lee

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Haley Parker.

Good Afternoon,
 
Here is the answer to your FOIA request.  The cost for the record is $5.87.  Please send payment to my attention at the Richmond Retirement System, 730 E. Broad Street, Suite 900, Richmond, VA  23219.
 
Thank you,

Kia Johnson
FOIA officer
